title: Timeline Era Schema
description: Standardized enumeration of historical eras in The Shadow Team Chronicles universe.

descriptions.description: Detailed explanations of each timeline era (not part of the enum, provided for documentation)

ancient_origins.description: Earliest recorded history through prehistoric developments and early civilizations.

mythical_age.description: Period of legendary figures and foundational myths that shape later cultural development.

old_kingdoms.description: Era of classical civilizations, empires, and the establishment of enduring cultural traditions.

imperial_expansion.description: Period marked by colonization, exploration, and growing global interconnection.

industrial_revolution.description: Era of rapid technological development, urbanization, and mechanization of production.

global_conflicts.description: Period dominated by world wars and international power struggles that reshape political landscapes.

information_age.description: Era defined by the rise of digital technology, computers, and early information networks.

corporate_ascendancy.description: Period when corporate power begins to eclipse traditional nation-states in global influence.

connectivity_era.description: Period of ubiquitous digital connectivity, social transformation, and early human augmentation.

quantum_age.description: Era defined by quantum computing breakthroughs and their revolutionary impact on technology and society.

transhuman_period.description: Time when human enhancement technologies become widespread, blurring the line between human and machine.

neo_feudalism.description: Era characterized by extreme stratification between elites with access to advanced technology and marginalized populations.

ecological_collapse.description: Period of environmental crisis and large-scale climate disasters forcing societal adaptation.

diaspora_era.description: Period of significant off-world colonization and the beginning of humanity's expansion beyond Earth.

new_renaissance.description: Era of cultural and technological revival after periods of crisis, featuring new forms of social organization.
